column3:
Closer, but now missing `copy_file_range` too:

```
ERROR: The syscall "copy_file_range" (syscall number 326) is not allowed by the syscall sandbox in thread "httpworker.2". Please report.
```
> Closer, but now missing copy_file_range too:\n\nAdded `copy_file_range` to the list of allowed file related syscalls. File related syscalls are already enabled for the HTTP worker threads.
ACK 44d77d2213e6bd2e2f700dd8c3c3f932bc1bcb48\n\nTested that this does fix the test issues I was running into.

Doing a GUIX build with #23179 and #23178 because I'm slightly afraid `newfstatat` & `copy_file_range` are new syscalls that need to be defined manually as well.\n\nIf so, do you mind if I cherry-pick this into  #23178?
> If so, do you mind if I cherry-pick this into #23178?\n\nYes that's fine.
Looks like it's not neccessary, GUIX build passes with those two PRs as-is.
I think it creates somewhat of a merge hotspot to re-align these comments every time something is added/removed.
